title: The ages of Ram and Shyam are in ratio 3:4 five years later. The sum of their ages will be 45 years. What are their present ages? - Quora

response.answer_text: Ratio of ages= 3:4 Let Ram's age = 3x ….Shyam's age = 4x A.T.Q After 5 yr Age of Ram = 3x + 5 Age of Shyam = 4x + 5 So,3x +5 + 4x + 5 = 45 7x + 10 = 45 7x = 35 x = 5 So, Ram's age = 5× 3 = 15 yrs Shyam's age = 4× 5 = 20 yr

I believe question is not properly worded. It should read : “ The ages of Ram and Shyam are in ratio 3:4. Five years later, the sum of their ages will be 45 Years. What are their present ages?” The answer is Ram is 15 years and Shyam is 20 years.
Say Rsm's age is 3 x and Shyam 4 x After five years their total age will be 7 x+10=45 x=5 Ram's age is 15 and Shyam' s 20 years.
Let the present age of Ram is 3x and Shyam is ,4x After 5 years, 3x+5+4x+5=45 7x=35 x=5 Present age of Ram is 15 and Shyam is 20
(3/(3+4))*(45–5–5)=3*35/7=15 and (4:7)*35=20 years . So present age of Ram is 15 years and Shyam’ s age is 20 years.
